alert.note: Alert for Barrow; DeKalb; Gwinnett; Newton; Oconee; Rockdale; Walton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 03 at 5:46PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Rockdale, northwestern Oconee, southeastern Barrow, southern DeKalb, northeastern Fayette, southeastern Gwinnett, northwestern Henry, northwestern Walton, Clayton and northwestern Newton Counties through 615 PM EST... At 545 PM EST, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from Snellville to Belmont to near Riverdale, and moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... McDonough, Conyers, Monroe, Jonesboro, Stockbridge, Forest Park, Snellville, Riverdale, Loganville, Morrow, Stone Mountain, Grayson, Lake City, Statham, Lithonia, Walnut Grove, Bethlehem, Between, Lakeview Estates and Georgia International Horse Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EST for north central and northeastern Georgia.

area.areaDesc: Barrow; DeKalb; Gwinnett; Newton; Oconee; Rockdale; Walton
